snippet: An Afghan soldier killed Maj. Gen. Harold J. Greene, who appeared to be the highest-ranking member of the American military to die in hostilities overseas since the Vietnam War.
abstract: United States Maj Gen Harold J Greene is killed when Afghan soldier opens fire on senior American officers at military training academy on outskirts of Kabul; Green is highest-ranking member of NATO-led coalition killed in Afghanistan war, and first US general killed in an overseas conflict since Vietnam.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg reported from Kabul, and Helene Cooper from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Haris Kakar, Ahmad Shakib and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul, Melissa Eddy from Berlin, and Patrick J. Lyons, Rick Gladstone and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.

lead_paragraph: An Afghan soldier killed Maj. Gen. Harold J. Greene, who appeared to be the highest-ranking member of the American military to die in hostilities overseas since the Vietnam War.

headline.main: U.S. General Is Killed in Attack at Afghan Base; Others Injured
headline.print_headline: Afghan Kills U.S. General; Others Injured

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
